messages.title: A Green Future With Natalie Bennett
messages.content: The EU 'leave' vote expressed frustration about the lack of control we have over our lives and communities. That's no surprise when a government, supported by just 24% of eligible voters, continues to back fracking, take local control over new school intake from councils, and privatize more of our NHS, and sell off public services and assets.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Greens call for urgent action to tackle air pollution by closing the Aldine House secure unit and Shirecliffe, Elm Lane, Shalesmoor, Barnsley Rd, and Jenkin Road to support the Sheffield Clean Air Zone.
Support local campaigns to save healthy street trees and calling on the Council to reverse their disastrous contracts.

issues.government: A government, supported by just 24% of eligible voters, continues to back fracking and privatize more of our NHS.

community.content: Support for local campaigns 'Save Crookes, Western Rd and Walkley Trees' & 'Save Rivelin Valley Rd, Hillsborough and Wadlsey trees.'

endorsements.endorsement: Runs our city and worked hard for Sheffield
